question: I am 31 year old woman who is two months pregnant(first baby =0) and been diagnosed with diabetes.  I have done research and come to find out my glucose test was in the range of pre-diabetes. I check my blood level four times a day and twice have had a level higher than 130.(about three week testing) I visited with the obgyn and she prescribed glyburide for me to take two times a day. I am not sure if this is a smart thing for me to be taking. I am also unsure cause I dont feel that they have discussed things with me like they should.  They just told me I have diabetes, never said I have pre-diabetes. I guess my question is is it right for her to prescribe me the medication while pregnant especially if I dont have the diabetes? What is a normal range of blood sugar I should have? They tells me 70-90  fasting, one said no higher than 110 two hours after meals, and another said 120's after meals.  I am confused and they are scarring me telling me this is wrong and that every time I leave and they wonder why my blood pressure is a lil high!
title: Don't feel too sure...
